DOC.brief_title: Comparison Supervised Unsupervised Physical Activity Programs During Weight Loss Intervention Adults
DOC.detailed_description: Approximately 69 % U.S. adult population overweight , define body mass index ( BMI ) ≥ 25.0 kg/m2 , 35 % obese ( BMI ≥ 30.0 kg/m2 ) , prevalence overweight obesity rise drastically past several decade . Adults overweight obese typically recommended change lifestyle factor ( e.g . diet , physical activity , etc . ) lose weight improve health . When evaluate effect lifestyle change weight health research setting , physical activity supervise ( i.e . physical activity complete health-fitness facility direct supervision train staff ) . With supervised physical activity , researcher able quantify frequency , intensity , duration , type physical activity . Thus , supervise physical activity consider gold-standard evaluate effect physical activity weight physiological parameter . However , result supervise physical activity trial may translate clinical setting . A typical clinical approach prescribes physical activity unsupervised manner ( i.e . physician tell patient physically active take steps/day ) . Unsupervised physical activity do environment time best suit individual . Knowing effect unsupervised physical activity important translation type physical activity non-research setting . Therefore , know magnitude physiological effect unsupervised physical activity compare supervised physical activity prescribe intensity dose clinical public health importance especially overweight obese population . This study design provide insight important research question inform future research application clinical , public health , health-fitness setting . Participants randomize one three group : supervised physical activity prescribe min/week ( SUP-PA ) , unsupervised physical activity prescribe min/week ( UNSUP-PA ) , unsupervised physical activity prescribe steps/day ( STEP ) . Participants three group participate behavioral weight loss intervention include dietary counsel weekly group session 12-week program . SUP-PA prescribed 150 minutes/week moderate-to-vigorous physical activity ( MVPA ) complete direct supervision train staff designate health-fitness facility . UNSUP-PA prescribed physical activity dose match SUP-PA . STEP prescribe 10,000 step/day recommendation 2,500 step complete `` brisk '' pace . The primary aim study compare effect three group moderate-to-vigorous physical activity ( MVPA ) accumulate bout least 10 minute . The primary outcome assess baseline , week 4 , week 8 , week 12 . Secondary aim trial include compare light intensity physical activity , sedentary time , cardiorespiratory fitness , weight , body composition , waist circumference measure , physical activity self-efficacy , blood pressure , dietary intake across three group . Secondary aim assess baseline week 12 .
DOC.criteria: Male Female Aged 1855 year old BMI 25.0 < 40.0 kg/m2 Ability provide inform consent Ability provide physician 's clearance participate weight loss intervention Engaging > 60 min/wk ( accumulate bout ≥10 minute ) moderatetovigorous physical activity past month Presence contraindication physical activity identify physical activity readiness questionnaire ( PARQ ) History metabolic , cardiac , pulmonary disease classifies individual high risk American College Sports Medicine ( e.g. , coronary heart disease , diabetes mellitus , uncontrolled hypertension , etc . ) History myocardial infarction , coronary bypass surgery , angioplasty , cardiovascular related surgery . Taking medication may affect heart rate blood pressure responses physical activity Resting systolic blood pressure ≥150mmHg diastolic blood pressure ≥100mmHg . Medication may affect body weight/metabolism ( e.g. , synthroid ) . Current previous participation physical activity weight management research project past 6 month Weight loss ≥5 % 15 pound total current body weight previous 6 month . Currently treat eat disorder ( e.g. , anorexia , bulimia , etc . ) Previously undergone bariatric surgery ( e.g. , lapband , gastric bypass , etc . ) For woman , currently pregnant , pregnant previous 6 month , plan become pregnant next 6 month Currently treat psychological issue problem , take psychotropic medication , receive treatment psychotropic medication within previous 6 month . Being town extend amount time weight loss intervention may affect participation study Currently use physical activity monitor track activity ( e.g. , Jawbone UP , Fitbit , etc . )
